alert.note: Alert for St. Charles; St. John The Baptist; Upper Lafourche (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 4:23PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A line of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of St. John The Baptist, east central Ascension, eastern St. James, northwestern St. Charles and north central Lafourche Parishes through 445 PM CDT... At 422 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms over Garyville, or near Reserve, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Reserve, Hahnville, Laplace, Gramercy, Lutcher, Killona, Norco, Montz, Edgard, South Vacherie, North Vacherie, Garyville, Wallace, Chackbay, Taft, New Sarpy and Destrehan. This includes Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 190 and 206. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: St. Charles; St. John The Baptist; Upper Lafourche
